block.p: Dr. Jeanne-Marie Lopez and Matthew Joseph Holstein were married yesterday at Sacred Heart Roman Catholic Church in Hartsdale, N.Y. The Rev. Divya Paul performed the ceremony.

The bride, 30, is keeping her name. She is a fellow in neuropsychology at the University of Medicine and Dentistry in Newark. She graduated from Swarthmore College and received a master's degree and a Ph.D. in clinical psychology from the Pacific Graduate School of Psychology. She is the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Raymond H. Lopez of Scarsdale, N.Y. Her father is a professor of economics and finance at Pace University in New York. Her mother, Margaret M. Lopez, is a nurse at the Mamaroneck (N.Y.) Child Development Center.
Dr. Jeanne-Marie Lopez and Matthew Joseph Holstein were married yesterday at Sacred Heart Roman Catholic Church in Hartsdale, N.Y. The Rev. Divya Paul performed the ceremony.

The bride, 30, is keeping her name. She is a fellow in neuropsychology at the University of Medicine and Dentistry in Newark. She graduated from Swarthmore College and received a master's degree and a Ph.D. in clinical psychology from the Pacific Graduate School of Psychology. She is the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Raymond H. Lopez of Scarsdale, N.Y. Her father is a professor of economics and finance at Pace University in New York. Her mother, Margaret M. Lopez, is a nurse at the Mamaroneck (N.Y.) Child Development Center.

The bridegroom, 28, is an information technology developer at Deutsche Bank Securities in New York. He graduated from the University of California at San Diego. He is a son of Beth Clark of El Cajon, Calif., and George Holstein of Coronado, Calif. His mother is the office manager at Hall Elementary School in El Cajon. His father, who is retired, was a computer analyst in San Diego for the Navy.
